name: PANDA (Regulatory Networks)
description:
PANDA (Passing Attributes between Networks for Data Assimilation) is a message-passing model that uses multiple sources of information (e.g. protein-protein interaction data and gene co-expression), to predict genome-wide, condition-specific regulatory networks. Further information is available at https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0064832
Note that if you want to use this tool for non-human data, you will need to first map to orthologous human genes due to PANDA's dependence on human-derived TF motif and protein-protein interaction data.
